org.apache.tamaya.core.internal

Class DefaultConfigurationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tamaya.core.internal.DefaultConfigurationContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationContext

    public class DefaultConfigurationContext
extends Object
implements ConfigurationContext
    Default implementation of a simple ConfigurationContext.

      • getPropertySources

        public List<PropertySource> getPropertySources()
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationContext
        This method returns the current list of registered PropertySources ordered via their ordinal. PropertySources with a lower ordinal come last. The PropertySource with the highest ordinal comes first. If two PropertySources have the same ordinal number they will get sorted using their class name just to ensure the user at least gets the same ordering after a JVM restart, hereby names before are added last. PropertySources are loaded when this method is called the first time, which basically is when the first time configuration is accessed.
        Specified by:
        getPropertySources in interface ConfigurationContext
        Returns:
        a sorted list of registered PropertySources. The returned list need not be modifiable

      • getPropertyConverters

        public Map<TypeLiteral<?>,List<PropertyConverter<?>>> getPropertyConverters()
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationContext

        This method returns the Map of registered PropertyConverters per type. The List for each type is ordered via their Priority and cladd name.

        A simplified scenario could be like:

          {
      Date.class -> {StandardDateConverter, TimezoneDateConverter, MyCustomDateConverter }
      Boolean.class -> {StandardBooleanConverter, FrenchBooleanConverter}
      Integer.class -> {DynamicDefaultConverter}
  }
        Specified by:
        getPropertyConverters in interface ConfigurationContext
        Returns:
        map with sorted list of registered PropertySources per type.

      • getPropertyConverters

        public <T> List<PropertyConverter<T>> getPropertyConverters(TypeLiteral<T> targetType)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationContext

        This method returns the registered PropertyConverters for a given type. The List for each type is ordered via their Priority.

        PropertyConverters with a higher Priority come first. The PropertyConverter with the lowest Priority comes last. If two PropertyConverter have the same ordinal number they will get sorted using their class name just to ensure the user at least gets the same ordering after a JVM restart.

        Additionally if a PropertyProvider is accessed, which is not registered the implementation should try to figure out, if there could be a default implementation as follows:

        1. Look for static factory methods: of(String), valueOf(String), getInstance(String), instanceOf(String), fomr(String)
        2. Look for a matching constructor: T(String).

        If a correspoding factory method or constructor could be found, a corresponding PropertyConverter should be created and registered automatically for the given type.

        The scenario could be like:

          {
      Date.class -> {MyCustomDateConverter,StandardDateConverter, TimezoneDateConverter}
      Boolean.class -> {StandardBooleanConverter, FrenchBooleanConverter}
      Integer.class -> {DynamicDefaultConverter}
  }

        The converters returned for a type should be used as a chain, whereas the result of the first converter that is able to convert the configured value, is taken as the chain's result. No more converters are called after a converter has successfully converted the input into the required target type.

        Specified by:
        getPropertyConverters in interface ConfigurationContext
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the type literal
        Parameters:
        targetType - type of the desired converter
        Returns:
        a sorted list of registered PropertySources per type.
